pr_title: [Telegram] Improved sending to a particular chat section

timeline.message:
Improved send to a particular chat section

I specified that the chatId in the APIs must be followed by an "L" or it won't work (at least, not for group chats).
I also mentioned that you can store the chatId inside a variable so that you can write it only once for the entire rules file.

timeline.bodyText: Although this is more related to the general rule language of OH, I agree that many users forgot to add the prefix and thus it makes sense to explain it here and to avoid further questions about it in the support forum.

timeline.bodyText: Hm... Here I tend to say that defining a global variable instead of passing the actual value is something that is not related to the Telegram binding and applies to all other bindings that define an action where you can pass something. If somebody doesn't know about that, I would refer to the general rule guide of OH (https://www.openhab.org/docs/configuration/rules-dsl.html).

+Just put the chat id (must be a long value!) followed by an "L" as the first argument to one of the above mentioned APIs:
 
 ```
 telegramAction.sendTelegram(1234567L, "Hello world!")
 ```
 
+You can also define a global variable to use in all your rules file:
+
+```
+val Id = 1234567L
+telegramAction.sendTelegram(Id, "Hello world!")
+```
